item.title: I/O multiplexing: select, poll and epoll
item.description: TL,DR. I/O multiplexing allows a process to simultaneously monitor multiple file descriptors to find out whether I/O is possible on any of them. The select() and poll() are system calls to monitor file descriptors. And the epoll is a Linux-specified API to implement I/O multiplexing with higher performance when it comes to large numbers of file descriptors. For now, this article is merely a copy/summary of the introduction of them in man pages.
